CatDescriptText: Mr. Albert Saunders, 213 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "I wouldn't say that he was guilty of misconduct in office, but I don't think that he used good judgement in the position of importance which he held.  As to whether or not he should have resigned, I say absolutely, he should have.  He did more harm waiting until he was forced to resign rather than resigning right away.  He did harm to himself and to the party."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Albert Saunders wearing dark suit and eyeglasses, holding newspaper, standing on Wood Street across from Liberty Photo Supply, Downtown
